One interesting correction to that article: The engine isn't brand new. It's actually a modified version of the Crystal Dynamics engine that powered the recent Tomb Raider games.

Also interesting is that, apparently, my assumption was incorrect.  The PC version is a port of the console code, and a port by a 3rd party developer at that.  (OGDB had reported this before, but their crowdsourced info can be hit-and-miss.)
It's by Nixxes, I believe, who also helped develop Tomb Raider: Anniversary (which had a pretty good PC version too).
They did a fantastic job; but for the dialogue system, you'd never guess the PC version wasn't the lead.
